title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A tale of love, wealth, and the American Dream in the Roaring Twenties.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A story of racial injustice and moral growth set in the American South during the Great Depression.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel exploring the dangers of totalitarianism and the impact of mass surveillance.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that satirizes social expectations and class distinctions in early 19th-century England.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A coming-of-age novel that explores themes of alienation and teenage angst.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel that follows the journey of Bilbo Baggins as he helps a group of dwarves reclaim their homeland.

title: The Harry Potter Series
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A series of fantasy novels following the life and adventures of a young wizard, Harry Potter.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: A dystopian series set in a future where teenagers are forced to participate in a televised death match.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic high-fantasy trilogy that follows the quest to destroy the One Ring.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: A novel exploring themes of obsession and revenge as Captain Ahab pursues the white whale.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia
author: C.S. Lewis
description: A series of high-fantasy novels that take readers to the magical land of Narnia.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
description: A magical realist novel that follows the Buend√≠a family in the fictional town of Macondo.

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
description: A horror novel that tells the story of a family's winter stay at the haunted Overlook Hotel.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A mystery thriller that follows symbologist Robert Langdon as he investigates a murder at the Louvre.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
author: John Green
description: A heartwarming novel that explores love and loss in the lives of two teenagers with cancer.

title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
description: Classic detective stories featuring the brilliant detective Sherlock Holmes and his loyal friend Dr. John Watson.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel that explores a futuristic society where people are engineered for specific roles and conformity is valued.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A gothic novel that tells the story of Victor Frankenstein, a scientist who creates a sapient creature through an unorthodox scientific experiment.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A philosophical novel that examines the consequences of living a life without consequences.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A post-apocalyptic novel that follows a father and son's journey through a desolate and dangerous world.

title: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland
author: Lewis Carroll
description: A whimsical and fantastical tale of a young girl named Alice who falls down a rabbit hole into a magical world.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: A gripping mystery novel featuring journalist Mikael Blomkvist and hacker Lisbeth Salander as they investigate a wealthy family's dark secrets.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A dystopian novel set in a future society where books are banned and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

title: The Outsiders
author: S.E. Hinton
description: A coming-of-age novel that explores the social divide between two rival groups, the Greasers and the Socs.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A dystopian novel that explores a theocratic society where women are oppressed and used for reproductive purposes.

title: A Clockwork Orange
author: Anthony Burgess
description: A dystopian novel that follows the story of Alex, a young delinquent involved in ultraviolence, as he undergoes a controversial rehabilitation experiment.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical novel that follows Santiago, a young shepherd, on his journey to find a hidden treasure.

title: The Metamorphosis
author: Franz Kafka
description: A surreal novella that tells the story of Gregor Samsa, who wakes up one morning to find himself transformed into a giant insect.

title: The Color Purple
author: Alice Walker
description: A novel that explores the struggles and triumphs of an African American woman named Celie in the early 20th century.

title: The Road Not Taken
author: Robert Frost
description: A collection of poems that reflects on life's choices and the paths we take.
